DataElement.preferredName: Basic Local Alignment Search Tool Input Programming Parameter Basic Local Alignment Search Tool Computer Program BLASTProgram
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A sequence search method designed to find regions of similarity between biological sequences.:Anything added into a sytem.:A value that is passed to a routine._A sequence search method designed to find regions of similarity between biological sequences.:A set of coded instructions, which a computer follows in processing data, performing an operation, or solving a logical problem, upon execution of the program._BLAST programs (algorithms) to use. Includes BLASTN, BLASTP and BLASTX.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Protein Basic Local Alignment Search Tool

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Protein Basic Local Alignment Search Tool
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of complex organic macromolecules composed of one or more chains (linear polymers) of alpha-L-amino acids linked by peptide bonds and ranging in size from a few thousand to over 1 million Daltons. Proteins are fundamental genetically encoded components of living cells with specific structures and functions dictated by amino acid sequence.:A sequence search method designed to find regions of similarity between biological sequences.

Concepts.definition: A group of complex organic macromolecules composed of one or more chains (linear polymers) of alpha-L-amino acids linked by peptide bonds and ranging in size from a few thousand to over 1 million Daltons. Proteins are fundamental genetically encoded components of living cells with specific structures and functions dictated by amino acid sequence.
A sequence search method designed to find regions of similarity between biological sequences.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nucleotide Basic Local Alignment Search Tool

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nucleotide Basic Local Alignment Search Tool
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subunit of DNA or RNA consisting of a nitrogenous base (adenine, guanine, thymine, or cytosine in DNA; adenine, guanine, uracil, or cytosine in RNA), a phosphate molecule, and a sugar molecule (deoxyribose in DNA and ribose in RNA).:A sequence search method designed to find regions of similarity between biological sequences.

Concepts.definition: A subunit of DNA or RNA consisting of a nitrogenous base (adenine, guanine, thymine, or cytosine in DNA; adenine, guanine, uracil, or cytosine in RNA), a phosphate molecule, and a sugar molecule (deoxyribose in DNA and ribose in RNA).
A sequence search method designed to find regions of similarity between biological sequences.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Protein Translation Basic Local Alignment Search Tool

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Protein Translation Basic Local Alignment Search Tool
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of complex organic macromolecules composed of one or more chains (linear polymers) of alpha-L-amino acids linked by peptide bonds and ranging in size from a few thousand to over 1 million Daltons. Proteins are fundamental genetically encoded components of living cells with specific structures and functions dictated by amino acid sequence.:The process that occurs at the ribosome whereby the information in mRNA is used to specify the sequence of amino acids in a polypeptide chain.:A sequence search method designed to find regions of similarity between biological sequences.

Concepts.definition: A group of complex organic macromolecules composed of one or more chains (linear polymers) of alpha-L-amino acids linked by peptide bonds and ranging in size from a few thousand to over 1 million Daltons. Proteins are fundamental genetically encoded components of living cells with specific structures and functions dictated by amino acid sequence.
The process that occurs at the ribosome whereby the information in mRNA is used to specify the sequence of amino acids in a polypeptide chain.
A sequence search method designed to find regions of similarity between biological sequences.
